articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States and the European Union called for a full investigation into reports of violations in an election in Georgia, where the president urged protests on Monday following the disputed parliamentary vote.
articles.title: US, EU call for probe after reports of Georgia election violations

articles.author: John Geddie, Chang-Ran Kim
articles.description: The make-up of Japan's future government was in flux on Monday after voters punished Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba's ruling coalition, leaving no party with a clear mandate to lead the world's fourth-largest economy.
articles.title: Japan's government in flux after election gives no party majority

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tehran will "use all available tools" to respond to Israel's weekend attack on military targets in Iran, Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesperson Esmaeil Baghaei said on Monday.
articles.title: Iran says it will 'use all available tools' to respond to Israel's attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Bulgaria's centre-right GERB party won a parliamentary election on Sunday, preliminary results showed, but it will have to seek a coalition partner to form a government.
articles.title: Bulgaria's GERB wins election, coalition talks in sight

articles.author: Steve Holland, Jeff Mason, James Oliphant
articles.description: Comedian Tony Hinchcliffe used crass language in joking that Latinos "love making babies" and called the Caribbean U.S. territory of Puerto Rico a "floating island of garbage."
articles.title: Trump rally at Madison Square Garden begins with vulgar, racist remarks from allies

articles.author: Christine Kiernan
articles.description: Canada and the U.S. must get tougher on Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government for trying to silence dissidents on foreign soil, a controversial Sikh separatist who was the target of an alleged India-led murder plot said in an interview.
articles.title: Sikh separatist claims Indian 'spy network' operates in US and Canada

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli military strikes on Jabalia, Beit Hanoun and Beit Lahiya have killed around 800 people during a three-week offensive, the Gaza health ministry said.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill dozens in north Gaza as raid deepens, medics say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 21 people including five children were wounded when Russian forces bombed Ukraine's second largest city Kharkiv and the surrounding region, Ukrainian officials said early on Monday.
articles.title: Russia pounds Ukraine's Kharkiv region, wounding 21

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British anti-Muslim activist Stephen Yaxley-Lennon, known by the pseudonym Tommy Robinson, on Monday admitted contempt of court by breaching an injunction made after he was successfully sued for libel.
articles.title: UK anti-Islam activist 'Tommy Robinson' admits breaching injunction

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's state council issued several measures to boost policies that support childbirth and promote a "childbirth-friendly society", the official Xinhua news agency said on Monday.
articles.title: China announces measures to boost births
